alert.note: Alert for Caldwell; Jackson; Lincoln; Ouachita; Union (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 11 at 10:53AM CDT by NWS Shreveport
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Caldwell, Jackson, south central Union, western Ouachita and southeastern Lincoln Parishes through 1145 AM CDT... At 1053 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 9 miles southeast of Ruston to near Jonesboro. Movement was east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Monroe, Claiborne, West Monroe, Brownsville-Bawcom, Brownsville-Bawcomville, Choudrant, Chatham, Eros, Drew, Fondale, Vixen, Calhoun, Bosco, Folksville, Cheniere, Mineral Springs, Caderville, Luna, Eureka and Lapine. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. These storms may intensify, so be certain to monitor local radio stations and available television stations for additional information and possible warnings from the National Weather Service. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 500 PM CDT for north central Louisiana.
